title: How to Change Google Chrome Default Language: Mobile & PC

steps.title: Open Google Chrome.
steps.content: Open Google Chrome. Currently, it's only possible to change Chrome's default display language on a Windows PC. [1] X Research source If you're using a Mac or Linux, Chrome can only display menus and other information in your system's default language . However, if you go to a website that's not in your system's default language, you'll always have the option to translate the page .

steps.title: Click ⋮.
steps.content: Click ⋮ . This vertical three-dot menu icon in the upper-right side of the browser window. A drop-down menu will appear. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Click Settings.
steps.content: Click Settings . You'll see this option near the bottom of the menu. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Click Languages.
steps.content: Click Languages . This option is in the second grouping of menu options on the left. [4] X Research source You'll now see a list of installed languages in the right panel. Your current default language displays the text "This language is used to display the Google Chrome UI."

steps.title: Click Add languages.
steps.content: Click Add languages . It's a link in the top right corner of the first section under "Preferred Languages." Clicking this will open a menu. [5] X Research source If you want to use a language that you already see in the list as your default language, just click the three dots next to the language's name and choose Display Google Chrome in this Language .

steps.title: Select a language.
steps.content: Select a language. Check the box to the left of the language that you want to add. You may have to scroll down to find the language that you want to use. Languages are arranged alphabetically.

steps.title: Click Add.
steps.content: Click Add . It's a blue button in the bottom-right corner of the pop-up window. Doing so places your selected language in the list of languages. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Set the language as default.
steps.content: Set the language as default. Click ⋮ to the right of the language dialect, then click Display Google Chrome in this language in the pop-up menu. [7] X Research source Changing the default language will not change your spell-check settings. To change spell-check settings, use the switches next to each language under "Spell Check" to enable or disable spell check for individual languages. After you set the language, click Relaunch to restart Chrome in the correct language. Once Chrome re-opens, your selected language will be used for things like Chrome's Settings menu and other built-in menu options.

steps.title: Open Chrome on your Android.
steps.content: Open Chrome on your Android. Tap the red, yellow, green, and blue sphere icon in your app list to launch Chrome. If you're using an iPhone or iPad, you won't be able to change the default language in Chrome. Chrome can only display in the language you're using as your iPhone or iPad's primary language . You can still translate individual web pages .

steps.title: Tap ⋮.
steps.content: Tap ⋮ . This vertical three-dot menu icon in the upper-right side of the browser window. A drop-down menu will appear. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Settings.
steps.content: Tap Settings . You'll see this option near the bottom of the drop-down menu. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Languages.
steps.content: Tap Languages . It's near the bottom of the menu under the "Advanced" header. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the current language.
steps.content: Tap the current language. This is next to "Current device language" at the top of the page and will open a list of languages. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the language you want to use.
steps.content: Tap the language you want to use. The setting will immediately take place and you'll be redirected back to the main "Settings" menu. [12] X Research source
